name: Felipe Nasr
introduction: Luiz Felipe de Oliveira Nasr (NAZ-er; born 21 August 1992 in Braslia, Federal District, Central-West Region, Brazil) is a Brazilian Formula One driver who formerly drove for the Sauber team. He made his dbut at the 2015 Australian Grand Prix. He continued racing for Sauber until Pascal Wehrlein took his place for the 2017 season.[1]
